definitions.definition: To plan, control and record the position and course of a vehicle, ship, aircraft, etc., on a journey; to follow a planned course.
definitions.example: He navigated the bomber to the Ruhr.

definitions.definition: To give directions, as from a map, to someone driving a vehicle.
To travel over water in a ship; to sail.
definitions.example: We navigated to France in the dinghy.

definitions.definition: To move between web pages, menus, etc. by means of hyperlinks, mouse clicks, or any other mechanism.
definitions.example: It was difficult to navigate back to the home page.

definitions.definition: To find a way through a difficult situation or process.
